data.title: Need for Code: Rivals
data.statement:
There are two frequent programmers on CodinGame, and they regularly encounter each other in Clashes. They want to know how many times they encounter each other within a [[duration]] of time.

Cody finishes after [[codyspeed]] and Parsy finishes after [[parsyspeed]] , <<both speeds are in minutes>>.

Parsy has [[duration]] hours of free time before heading back to work, and he would like to know how many clashes he can play where he encounters Cody.

Output how many clashes they can both play where they encounter each other. Or output {{No Encounters}} if they <<never>> encounter each other during the duration of free time.

Both Cody and Parsy start their first clash <<without>> encountering each other.
When they finish <<one clash at the same time>>, they <<always encounter each othe>>r in the following clash.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
```
EXAMPLE:

Parsy finishes in 15 minutes
Cody finishes in 10 minutes
Duration is 1 hour or 60 minutes

  Time	   Cody	     Parsy
 0 mins: clash #1  clash #1 (Not an encounter)
10 mins: clash #2  
15 mins:           clash #2
20 mins: clash #3  
30 mins: clash #4  clash #3 (Encounter 1)
40 mins: clash #5  
45 mins:           clash #4
50 mins: clash #6
60 mins: TIMEâ€™S UP, NO MORE CLASHES!```

<<Output: {{1}}>>
data.constraints:
0 min < [[codyspeed]] <= 15 min
0 min < [[parsyspeed]] <= 15 min
0 hrs < [[duration]] <= 4 hrs
data.stubGenerator:
read codyspeed:int
read parsyspeed:int
read duration:int

write Encounters
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer, [[codyspeed]] per clash in <<minutes>>.
<<Line 2:>> An integer, [[parsyspeed]] per clash in <<minutes>>.
<<Line 3:>> An integer, [[duration]] of free time in <<hours>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There are two frequent programmers on CodinGame, and they regularly encounter each other in Clashes. They want to know how many times they encounter each other within a duration of time.

Cody finishes after codyspeed and Parsy finishes after parsyspeed , both speeds are in minutes.

Parsy has duration hours of free time before heading back to work, and he would like to know how many clashes he can play where he encounters Cody.

Output how many clashes they can both play where they encounter each other. Or output No Encounters if they never encounter each other during the duration of free time.

Both Cody and Parsy start their first clash without encountering each other.
When they finish one clash at the same time, they always encounter each other in the following clash.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EXAMPLE:

Parsy finishes in 15 minutes
Cody finishes in 10 minutes
Duration is 1 hour or 60 minutes

  Time	   Cody	     Parsy
 0 mins: clash #1  clash #1 (Not an encounter)
10 mins: clash #2  
15 mins:           clash #2
20 mins: clash #3  
30 mins: clash #4  clash #3 (Encounter 1)
40 mins: clash #5  
45 mins:           clash #4
50 mins: clash #6
60 mins: TIME’S UP, NO MORE CLASHES!


Output: 1




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: An integer, codyspeed per clash in minutes.
Line 2: An integer, parsyspeed per clash in minutes.
Line 3: An integer, duration of free time in hours.

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: number_of_encounters or No Encounters

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 min < codyspeed <= 15 min
0 min < parsyspeed <= 15 min
0 hrs < duration <= 4 hrs

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
10
15
1

         

         

            
Output

            
1
